name: Least k such that there exist two distinct subsets of {0, ..., k-1} with the same sum of m-th powers for 0 <= m <= n.
comment: Two such sets must have the same size, since the exponent m = 0 is allowed (with the usual convention that 0^0 = 1).
a(n) is the smallest k such that A382833(k,n) < 2^k.
example: n | a(n) | subsets with the same sums of powers
author: _Pontus von Brömssen_, Apr 10 2025

name: Square array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of distinct sum-of-powers vectors (Sum_{x in X} x^m, 0 <= m <= k) for subsets X of {0, ..., n-1}; n, k >= 0.
formula: T(n,k) <= 2^n with equality if and only if n < A382832(k).
example: For n = 4, k = 1, there is only one pair of subsets of {0, 1, 2, 3} for which the two subsets have the same number of elements (sum of 0th powers) and the same sum (sum of 1st powers), namely {0, 3}, {1, 2}. Hence, T(4,1) = 2^4-1 = 15.
author: _Pontus von Brömssen_, Apr 10 2025
